instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2879: What is 820-2879? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charger shorts with battery connected
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> first it was not charge (ppbus 1.5v) i was changed <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> now its turn on with charger(green light) and with battery but its not turn on automatically with just charger(no auto fan spin) but work just with power button. 
with charger there is green light but when i connect the battery the green light turn off.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charger shorts with battery connected
threads.message: now ppbus is 19.4v with just charger and with just battery 10.8v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charger shorts with battery connected
threads.message:
Power button must be triggered for Core 2 machines with NVidia MCP to turn on.
Shorted <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> or bad soldering of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charger shorts with battery connected
threads.message: <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> no short <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> sholdering again, power button work with battery and with charger..
